meanings.definition: A person or thing that stops or halts something.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight acted as a stopper, preventing the dragon from entering the village.
meanings.sent2: The traffic light served as a stopper, controlling the flow of cars.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel decided to be a stopper and hide all the acorns from the other animals.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was a stopper to the serious conversation, lightening the mood instantly.
meanings.sent5: The giant boulder acted as a stopper, blocking the path completely.

meanings.definition: A cork or other object used to close a bottle or container.
meanings.sent1: She carefully placed the stopper back in the wine bottle to keep it fresh.
meanings.sent2: The perfume bottle had a beautiful crystal stopper to seal in the fragrance.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat batted the stopper off the bottle and watched it roll away.
meanings.sent4: His words were like a stopper, sealing her heart from further pain.
meanings.sent5: The stopper on the soda bottle popped loudly when opened, releasing the fizz.

meanings.definition: A block or plug used to fill a hole or gap.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter inserted a wooden stopper into the hole to secure the shelf.
meanings.sent2: The sink was leaking, so she quickly placed a rubber stopper to stop the water.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous child pretended to be a stopper for the leaky faucet, trying to block the water.
meanings.sent4: His apology was like a stopper for the argument, closing any further discussion.
meanings.sent5: The dam acted as a stopper, holding back the rushing water.
